page.title: 05EPPERSTONE MANOR
page.content: History reveals that a Manor House existed at Epperstone at the time of the Norman Conquest and certainly mention is made of it in the Domesday Book in 1086. Over the years many alterations and additions have been taken to preserve the character and style of this beautiful house.The panelled hall and Jacobean style staircase, the elegant plasterwork ceiling in the Garden Room are worthy of note.Occupancy of the Manor has changed hands on numerous occasions over the years, and was once believed to be the residence of Lord Howe, Governor of Barbados. The Manor became the former County Police H.Q. in 1954 until the amalgamation with the Nottingham City Police in 1968 when it was developed as the Police Training School.
